cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (below SSHS Category scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 175 miles south of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north across the Yucatán Channel on Sunday, enter the southern–central Gulf of Mexico Monday, then accelerate north-northeast toward the northeast Gulf Coast (Florida Panhandle/Big Bend) by mid-week.

weather_observation.within_uncertainty_cone: Yes (western edge of cone passes over coastal MS/AL)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Tulum to Cabo Catoche (Yucatán) – Tropical Storm Watch; no U.S. coast in watches yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: Pinar del Río and Isle of Youth, Cuba – Tropical Storm Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and eastern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through Mississippi, Alabama, and especially the Florida Panhandle/Big Bend
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (most heavy rain projected east of Mississippi)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Tuesday night into Wednesday with low–moderate confidence.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation 1–3 ft possible if the track shifts west, otherwise negligible.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of intermittent heavy showers Tuesday–Wednesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased seas and dangerous rip currents throughout the north-central Gulf beginning late Monday.
